aligned_sections.original_content: The Seller agrees to sell, and the Buyer agrees to purchase, the real property located at 742 Maple Street, Riverside Heights, State of California, 92501 (the "Property"). The Property is legally described as Lot 24, Block 7, of Riverside Heights Subdivision, as recorded in Book 145, Page 312, of the Official Records of Riverside County, California. The sale includes all fixtures permanently attached to the Property, including but not limited to: built-in appliances, ceiling fans, window treatments, landscaping, and the existing security system.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The Seller agrees to sell, and the Buyer agrees to purchase, the real property located at 742 Maple Street, Riverside Heights, State of California, 92501 (the "Property"). The Property is legally described as Lot 24, Block 7, of Riverside Heights Subdivision, as recorded in Book 145, Page 312, of the Official Records of Riverside County, California. The sale includes all fixtures permanently attached to the Property, including but not limited to: built-in appliances, ceiling fans, window treatments, landscaping, and the existing security system.

aligned_sections.original_content: The total purchase price for the Property shall be Four Hundred Seventy-Five Thousand Dollars ($475,000 USD). Within three (3) business days of the Effective Date, Buyer shall deposit Fifteen Thousand Dollars ($15,000 USD) as earnest money with Pacific Coast Escrow Services (the "Escrow Agent"). The Buyer intends to obtain a conventional mortgage loan in the amount of $380,000 USD, representing approximately 80% of the purchase price. The Buyer shall have 21 days from the Effective Date to obtain a written loan commitment from a qualified lender. The balance of the purchase price, less the earnest money deposit, shall be paid in cash or certified funds at closing. If the Buyer, despite good faith efforts, is unable to obtain financing approval within the specified period, either party may terminate this Agreement, and the earnest money shall be returned to the Buyer in full.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The total purchase price for the Property shall be Four Hundred Sixty-Five Thousand Dollars ($465,000 USD). Within three (3) business days of the Effective Date, Buyer shall deposit Twenty Thousand Dollars ($20,000 USD) as earnest money with Pacific Coast Escrow Services (the "Escrow Agent"). The Buyer intends to obtain a conventional mortgage loan in the amount of Three Hundred Seventy-Two Thousand Dollars ($372,000 USD), representing approximately 80% of the purchase price. The Buyer shall have twenty-eight (28) days from the Effective Date to obtain a written loan commitment from a qualified lender. The balance of the purchase price, less the earnest money deposit, shall be paid in cash or certified funds at closing. If the Buyer, despite good faith efforts, is unable to obtain financing approval within the specified period, either party may terminate this Agreement, and the earnest money shall be returned to the Buyer in full.

aligned_sections.original_content: The Buyer shall have ten (10) days from the Effective Date to conduct, at Buyer's expense, any inspections deemed necessary, including but not limited to: general home inspection, pest inspection, roof inspection, and environmental assessments. If the inspections reveal material defects that the Seller is unwilling to repair or credit, the Buyer may terminate this Agreement within the inspection period and receive a full refund of the earnest money deposit. The Seller shall provide a completed Property Disclosure Statement within five (5) days of the Effective Date, disclosing all known material defects affecting the Property.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The Buyer shall have fourteen (14) days from the Effective Date to conduct, at Buyer's expense, any inspections deemed necessary, including but not limited to: general home inspection, pest inspection, roof inspection, and environmental assessments. If the inspections reveal material defects that the Seller is unwilling to repair or credit, the Buyer may terminate this Agreement within the inspection period and receive a full refund of the earnest money deposit. The Seller shall provide a completed Property Disclosure Statement within five (5) days of the Effective Date, disclosing all known material defects affecting the Property.

aligned_sections.original_content: The Seller shall provide, at Seller's expense, a standard owner's title insurance policy issued by a reputable title company, insuring the Buyer's title to the Property in the amount of the purchase price. The Seller warrants that at closing, the Property shall be conveyed with clear and marketable title, free from all liens, encumbrances, and defects, except for: current year property taxes not yet due, recorded easements and restrictions of record, and zoning ordinances. The closing of this transaction shall occur on or before April 30, 2024, unless extended by mutual written agreement of the parties. The Seller shall pay: real estate commissions, documentary transfer taxes, and one-half of the escrow fees. The Buyer shall pay: loan origination fees, appraisal fees, recording fees, and one-half of the escrow fees.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The Seller shall provide, at Seller's expense, a standard owner's title insurance policy issued by a reputable title company, insuring the Buyer's title to the Property in the amount of the purchase price. The Seller warrants that at closing, the Property shall be conveyed with clear and marketable title, free from all liens, encumbrances, and defects, except for: current year property taxes not yet due, recorded easements and restrictions of record, and zoning ordinances. The closing of this transaction shall occur on or before May 15, 2024**, unless extended by mutual written agreement of the parties. The Seller shall pay: real estate commissions, documentary transfer taxes, and one-half of the escrow fees. The Buyer shall pay: loan origination fees, appraisal fees, recording fees, and one-half of the escrow fees.

aligned_sections.original_content: The Seller agrees to maintain the Property in its present condition, ordinary wear and tear excepted, and shall deliver the Property in broom-clean condition at closing. The Seller shall bear all risk of loss or damage to the Property until the closing date. If the Property is substantially damaged prior to closing, the Buyer may terminate this Agreement. The Buyer shall be entitled to possession of the Property at "5:00 PM on the closing date", following the recording of the deed and disbursement of funds. The Buyer shall have the right to conduct a final walkthrough inspection of the Property within "twenty-four (24) hours" prior to closing to verify the condition of the Property.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The Seller agrees to maintain the Property in its present condition, ordinary wear and tear excepted, and shall deliver the Property in broom-clean condition at closing. The Seller shall bear all risk of loss or damage to the Property until the closing date. If the Property is substantially damaged prior to closing, the Buyer may terminate this Agreement.

aligned_sections.original_content: The Seller represents and warrants that: (a) The Seller has full authority to sell the Property; (b) There are no pending or threatened legal actions affecting the Property; (c) All mechanical systems and appliances are in working order; (d) The Property complies with all applicable zoning and building codes. The Buyer represents and warrants that: (a) The Buyer has the financial capacity to complete this transaction; (b) The Buyer has reviewed and accepted the Property Disclosure Statement; (c) The Buyer is not relying on any representations not contained herein.
aligned_sections.amended_content: The Seller represents and warrants that: (a) The Seller has full authority to sell the Property; (b) There are no pending or threatened legal actions affecting the Property; (c) All mechanical systems and appliances are in working order; (d) The Property complies with all applicable zoning and building codes. The Buyer represents and warrants that: (a) The Buyer has the financial capacity to complete this transaction; (b) The Buyer has reviewed and accepted the Property Disclosure Statement; (c) The Buyer is not relying on any representations not contained herein.

aligned_sections.original_content: If the Buyer fails to perform under this Agreement, the Seller may retain the earnest money deposit as liquidated damages, which shall be the Seller's sole and exclusive remedy.
aligned_sections.amended_content: If the Buyer fails to perform under this Agreement, the Seller may retain the earnest money deposit as liquidated damages, which shall be the Seller's sole and exclusive remedy.

aligned_sections.original_content: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties and supersedes all prior negotiations, representations, and agreements relating to the Property. This Agreement may not be modified except by written instrument signed by both parties. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California. Time is of the essence with respect to all dates and deadlines specified in this Agreement. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective heirs, successors, and assigns.
aligned_sections.amended_content: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties and supersedes all prior negotiations, representations, and agreements relating to the Property. This Agreement may not be modified except by written instrument signed by both parties. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California. Time is of the essence with respect to all dates and deadlines specified in this Agreement. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective heirs, successors, and assigns.
